instruction: Can you explain to me what the "uncanny valley" refers to?

But eventually, once a robot has evolved into a humanoid form, the human observer begins to notice traits that are not yet human, which leads to a sense of “un-human-ness” or dissonance, and they become repulsed.  The “uncanny valley” is the point on the “human-likeness scale” where this effect happens.

instruction: What does the phrase "SOS" stand for? How was it created?
response:
It’s the International Morse Code emergency signal for “help.” The symbol of three dots, two dashes, and three dots was originally “S” or “Save Our Ship,” but the modern use is just the pattern. It’s still used in some maritime contexts for navigation and maritime signaling.  This is the story behind it.  Basically, a guy named Herbert O. Yardley was trying to invent a radio telegraph that could transmit Morse code without the use of a “sounder,” which was a telegraph key that would produce a tone and the typist would then transmit Morse code by copying that tone into the Morse key.  To produce the Morse code without the sounder, Yardley tried drawing dots and dashes on a “scrambled” typewriter, where the keys were all in random locations.  But this wasn’t as fast as typing by sound, so he taped the typewriter to the table and pounded out the dots and dashes with a hammer instead.  He drew this up on a sheet of paper, and realized that the set of dots and dashes made a symbol.

Yardley took his “SOS” drawings to Western Union, but the manager and his engineers were not interested.  Instead, they began using the SOS letters in their telegraph messages, for both emergency and test purposes.  

Later, the SOS signal was first used in a distress situation.  On November 7, 1898, the passenger steamer SS Wampanoag in the Atlantic Ocean sent out the call, “Come to the assistance of the SS Wampanoag, barque S.S. Abarenda, barque S.S. Wyoming, and sailing vessel Baltic.  Come to our relief.”  This came from a distress call sent out by the captain, C.D. Wadleigh, from the sinking SS Wampanoag.

Then later, in 1906, the SOS signal was standardized and became international.

instruction: Can you describe how an autonomous car works?
response:
One way to think about it is this:  You can make a car without a human driver in two different ways.  The first is to put a robot in the car, which is kind of like a remote-control helicopter.  The robot would have a video camera, some artificial intelligence, and some sensors.  When you are driving, you would be able to see out the window and steer and accelerate and brake with a joystick or other controls, so it’s like you are driving, but you aren’t.  You’d control the robot, and the robot would control the car.  If you wanted to be super safe, you could build an extra sensor in the car that would only drive in the safest conditions, and when there were hazards, or if the car sensed the driver wasn’t doing what they should, then the robot would actually take over control of the car and drive it instead.  This is the safer way, but it would also be kind of slow because the robot would just be doing the exact same thing that you would have done, and if you messed up, the robot would also mess up.

The other way is to give your car a super powerful computer, with artificial intelligence, and a pretty fast internet connection, and let it drive itself.  This car would also have some sensors, but it wouldn’t really need them, because it would always have access to so much more information than you do.  When you are driving, you would choose where you want to go, and your car would use all of its data to come up with the best route and way to get there.  The computer would make all the decisions about how to handle unexpected events and road conditions, and would do the braking and steering and everything.  It’s kind of like having a flying car that is in control of everything, and you just decide where you want to go.  Most people use cars like this, because they’re pretty good and most of the time you don’t really want to do all of that work and risking making a mistake.

instruction: Can you give me a recipe for angel food cake?
response:
Sure, here’s one recipe:

Ingredients

1 cup cake flour
1 teaspoon salt
1⁄2 teaspoon baking powder
3 tablespoons white vinegar
3⁄4 cup sugar
4 large egg whites, at room temperature
4 large egg yolks, at room temperature
1⁄2 cup solid vegetable shortening
2 cups (1 pint) fresh berries (mix berries and their juice)
Whipped topping (optional)

Steps

Preheat oven to 325° F (163° C) and prepare an angel food pan.  Cream together the sugar and shortening until smooth.  Add eggs, one at a time, beating well after each addition.  Slowly add the dry ingredients.  Beat until fluffy.  Fold in the berries (and berry juice) by hand.

Pour the batter into the prepared pan, then bake for 60 to 75 minutes or until set.  Cool, then refrigerate and serve with whipped topping.  Refrigerate leftovers, but bring them to room temperature before serving.

instruction: What are symptoms of whiplash?
response: Whiplash is a symptom caused by trauma to the neck or head and results in neck pain and stiffness. The symptoms tend to occur in one of two types, post-traumatic and acute whiplash. In post-traumatic whiplash, the individual experiences pain that develops more gradually than in acute whiplash. Individuals may also experience neck and shoulder pain, headache, dizziness, difficulty concentrating, nausea, vomiting, neck stiffness, irritability, or unsteadiness. In acute whiplash, the person experiences neck pain and stiffness that occurs within hours to days of a traumatic incident.

instruction: I like to host guests at my home from time to time, and I am gathering  recipes of different dishes and drinks to keep things interesting. I am interested in trying some Argentinian dishes. Can you give me a recipe for Berenjenas en escabeche?
response:
Sure, I’m happy to help! Berenjenas en escabeche is a marinated eggplant dish.  Here’s a recipe:

Ingredients
6 small eggplants, cut into rounds
3 garlic cloves, minced
2 bay leaves
2 sprigs of thyme, leaves only
1 teaspoon whole black peppercorns
1/2 cup red wine vinegar
1/2 cup extra-virgin olive oil
Salt

Directions
Wash and pat dry the eggplant.
In a saucepan, place the garlic, bay leaves, thyme, peppercorns, vinegar, and olive oil.
Place the eggplant into the saucepan and bring to a simmer.
Turn down heat to low and cook for 5 minutes.
Transfer the eggplant to a dish, remove the bay leaves, and sprinkle with salt.

I’ve also found this blog post which summarizes a more traditional approach from Argentina, where the eggplant is fried and the bay leaves are omitted.

instruction: I like to host guests at my home from time to time, and I am gathering  recipes of different dishes and drinks to keep things interesting. I am interested in trying some Irish dishes. Can you give me a recipe Shepherd's Pie?
response:
It sounds like you have a menu planned and want to try some new options for your guests. You should try a few dishes on a regular rotation, rather than trying every dish once. The only recipe I know for shepherd’s pie is the following:

Shepherd’s Pie

Ingredients

9 oz. extra-lean ground beef

1 medium onion, diced

2 large celery stalks, diced

2 cloves garlic, minced

1 medium carrot, diced

1/2 cup frozen mixed vegetables (peas and corn)

1 cup frozen peas

2 cups ready-to-serve mashed potatoes

2-1/4 cups milk

1 tablespoon Dijon mustard

1/2 teaspoon ground black pepper

1/2 teaspoon kosher salt

1/2 cup grated cheddar cheese

Heat oven to 350°F. Spray an 8-inch square baking dish with cooking spray. In a large skillet, brown ground beef over medium-high heat. Drain fat. Add onion, celery, garlic, and carrot. Cook, stirring, until vegetables are softened. Add frozen mixed vegetables, frozen peas, potatoes, milk, mustard, black pepper, and salt; stir to combine. Transfer mixture to the baking dish; top with cheese. Bake until top is golden and cheese is melted, 25 to 30 minutes.

instruction: There's a heavy Creole influences in terms of cooking in the US. Can you tell me more about Creole cooking, such as its history and the flavors of Creole?
response: Sure! Creole cooking is a fusion of the cooking styles of the Native Americans and West Africans.  It’s common to see it in the South-Eastern states, especially in Louisiana, where Cajun and Creole cooking are popular.  In many cases, the West African flavors are much more subtle, and their main influence comes from the preparation of vegetables and other foods, which use some of the same cooking methods as West African cuisine.  It’s possible that this is because many Creole families left West Africa for the Americas on slave ships, so the food traditions of their ancestors were part of their cultural background.  So the main thing you’ll see with Creole cooking is a lot of spicy flavors, especially from the French and Spanish colonization of the New World.  In fact, many Caribbean and Latin American dishes have their roots in Creole cooking!

instruction: How should I react if a bear attacks me in the woods?
response: That depends on the bear, and on your perspective.  If the bear attacks you, you should use force to defend yourself.  If you are walking on a trail in the woods and you see a bear ahead of you, you should back away, because you could approach the bear without him noticing and accidentally provoke an attack.  If you are surprised by a bear while you are in the woods, you should first freeze and wait for the bear to approach, as it may be confused and will respond better to slow movements.  Then you can slowly back away while keeping your eyes on the bear, while shouting or making some noise to scare it away.  If the bear still attacks you, you should try to scare it away by yelling or throwing rocks, and then, if necessary, by striking it with your hands or by throwing it to the ground and hitting it until it lets you go.  In a situation where you cannot retreat, like when you are caught in a bear den, you should try to avoid making any threatening gestures or sounds, and you should keep your arms tucked in, making yourself as small as possible.

instruction: What is the difference between a KN95 mask and an N95 mask?
response: The names of these masks refer to how effective they are at blocking particulate matter.  The KN95 (K for Korea) are made in Korea and have a filtering efficiency of 95%.  The N95 mask (N for North America) are made in North America and are similarly highly effective at blocking particulate matter.  If you can get your hands on either of these masks I would recommend them.  In general, there is a tradeoff between comfort and breathing resistance.  Faceshields can fit tightly to the face and restrict airflow.  Respirators can be more comfortable and breathable, but less effective at blocking the passage of particles.

instruction: What is the origin of the story of Santa Claus? Who thought him up?

There are also many similar traditions and beliefs about spiritual protectors, or Santa Claus, in Scandinavia, like Jultomten and Pere Fransk. Also, the modern figure is based on some of the Scandinavian traditions, but mainly it is based on the European Santa Claus and his American counterpart.

instruction: how do I support someone who is depressed?
response:
To help someone who is feeling depressed, I recommend keeping a dialogue open and avoiding certain behaviors.  Here are some behaviors I’d recommend avoiding:

Telling the person “It’s not a big deal” or “get over it”.

Telling the person to “get out of bed” or “get off your butt”.

Telling the person “get back to normal”.

Telling the person “don’t be so silly” or “you’re not depressed” or “you don’t have any reason to feel depressed”.

Telling the person “you’ll feel better tomorrow” or “after a day you’ll feel better”.

Asking “why” the person feels depressed.

It’s also very important to avoid making the person feel guilty for feeling depressed.

instruction: Thanksgiving is coming up, and I need a recipe for cranberry sauce. Can you help?
response:
Sure! I’ll give you some basic directions and you can modify them as you want. Here’s how you can make cranberry sauce:

1. You will need cranberries, sugar, and water.

2. Measure out some cranberries, and put them in a pot.

3. Add water.

4. Bring the water to a boil.

5. Add sugar.

6. Cook, stirring occasionally, until the cranberries become soft, or are “popped”.

7. If you want a chunkier consistency, let the cranberries cool and drain off the water.

8. Add more water and let boil.

9. When you want to use the sauce, take some of it off the heat, let cool, and refrigerate.  When it’s cool, it will be thick.

instruction: I heard that corn originated from North America, is that true?
response: The facts are a little complex, but from about eight million years ago to the present there has been an entire range of human ancestors who used to have different evolutionary paths, and many of them were found in parts of the world that no longer exist.  It’s not known which of the surviving human ancestor species invented agriculture, which first used fire, or whether any of the original species spread agriculture over the earth.  But more than five million years ago, all humans were living as hunter-gatherers, and the last hunter-gatherer human species became extinct about ten thousand years ago.  The first agriculture probably began within a few hundred thousand years ago.
